alert.note: Alert for Essex; Middlesex; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 4:30PM EST until January 14 at 5:15PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Essex County in northeastern Massachusetts... Northeastern Suffolk County in eastern Massachusetts... East central Middlesex County in northeastern Massachusetts... * Until 515 PM EST. * At 430 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Georgetown to Waltham, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Lynn, Somerville, Waltham, Malden, Medford, Revere, Peabody, Arlington, Everett, Salem, Beverly, Woburn, Gloucester, North Andover, Melrose, Saugus, Danvers, Wakefield, and Reading. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
